description: unique identifier for a segment
name for the segment for use in a report or user interface
Event or race type corresponding to side A (e.g. full or half) in a comparison with event_b.
Event or race type corresponding to side B (e.g. full or half) in a comparison with event_a.
Start kilometer mark of this segment for event_a expressed as the actual distance from the official start line of event A (not normalized or scaled).
End kilometer mark of this segment for event_a, expressed as the actual course distance for event A. Represents the true on-course position, not a normalized segment fraction.
Start kilometer mark of this segment for event_b measured from the official start line of event B. This is the real race distance point, not a normalized or relative value.
End kilometer mark of this segment for event_b, measured as the actual cumulative distance of event b. Represents the physical location along the race route.
Width of the course for this segment
Indicates flow relationship type between event A and event B.
enum_definitions:
"co-flow": "Both events move in the same direction along the segment.",
"counter-flow": "Events move in opposite directions along the same segment.",
"shared": "Events overlap in space and/or time with mixed directions.",
"divergent": "Events split into separate routes after this segment.",
"convergent": "Events merge onto the same route, increasing density."

description: Event the runner is participating in and can be one of: full, half, 10K, elite or open
Unique ID for the runner
The average speed for the runner of the event
Distance in kilometers for event
The event has a start-time and this offset is the delay for the runner crossing the starting mat.
Unique identifer for the location
Description of the location for use in reporting or in the user interface
Can be one of traffic, course, aid, water
Zone is a geographic area of the course for operational planning.
Latitude of the location for mapping purposes
Longitude of the location for mappng purposes
Time first runner is expected at this location
Time of the peak window starting where peak is 25th to 75th percentile.
Time of the peak window ending where peak is 25th to 75th percentile.
Time last runner is expected at this location
Time resource to be at location
Time resource can leave location
Duration resource on location
Modelled where the system has provided timing, or based on a proxy from another location
Notes about the location for use in reports or the user interface
